Name: Boke
Description: Boke is located in the western part of Guinea, known for its rich natural resources, including bauxite.

Name: Conakry
Description: Conakry is the capital city and the largest urban area of Guinea, located on the Atlantic coast.

Name: Faranah
Description: Faranah is located in central Guinea and is known for its agriculture and traditional crafts.

Name: Kankan
Description: Kankan is located in the eastern part of Guinea and is known for its cultural heritage, including being an important center of the Mandingo culture.

Name: Kerouane
Description: Kerouane is in southeastern Guinea, known for its agricultural activities and natural landscapes.

Name: Labe
Description: Labe is located in the central highlands of Guinea, with a focus on cattle breeding and agriculture.

Name: Mamou
Description: Mamou is located in the central part of Guinea and is an important crossroads for transportation and commerce.

Name: Nzerekore
Description: Nzerekore is located in the southeastern part of Guinea and is known for its diverse ethnic groups and agriculture.

Name: Siguiri
Description: Siguiri is located in the northeastern part of Guinea, known for its mining activities, particularly gold.

Name: Telimele
Description: Telimele is located in the western part of Guinea, known for its agricultural activities, including rice and maize farming.
